name: API Gateway Architecture
description: Microservices with unified entry point (API Gateway) that routes requests to backend services. Gateway handles cross-cutting concerns like authentication, logging, rate limiting.

gateway_types.description: Different gateway per client type (web, mobile, desktop)
Multiple gateway layers for different concerns

indicators.name: gateway_service
indicators.description: Dedicated API Gateway service (Kong, NGINX, custom)

indicators.name: backend_services
indicators.description: Multiple backend services accessed through gateway

indicators.name: cross_cutting_concerns
indicators.description: Authentication, logging, rate limiting in gateway

benefits: Single entry point for external clients
Decouples clients from backend service URLs
concerns: Single point of failure if not replicated
Gateway can become 'God Service' with too many responsibilities
when_to_use: Multiple backend services needing unified interface
Different API versions for different clients

required_practices.description: Multiple gateway instances for high availability
